content: tbl p2 k2 m1r k9 p1 k4 k2tog p1 ssk k4 p1 32/12 sts rnds 39-40 k9 p1 k2 p2 k1 tbl p1 k1 tbl p2 k2 p1 k9 p1 k5 p1 k5 p1 heel the heel is worked back and forth† from side to side across the bottom then closed at the back with a 3-needle bind off row restart at 1 in this section setup k9 then put the 13 gusset sts on a holder and turn to ws row 1 ws p9 k1 p5 k1 p5 k1 p9 turn to rs 31 sts the table below shows rs shaping row only all ws row are worked in pattern row 2 rs k9 p1 k3 k2tog p1 ssk k3 p1 k9 turn to ws 29 sts row 4 k9 p1 k2 k2tog p1 ssk k2 p1 k9 turn to ws 27 sts row 6 k9 p1 k1 k2tog p1 ssk k1 p1 k9 turn to ws 25 sts row 8 k9 p1 k2tog p1 ssk p1 k9 turn to ws 23 sts row 10 k9 p1 k1 p1 k1 p1 k9 turn to ws 21 sts row 12 k9 p1 ssk -- -- -- 20 sts work a 3-needle bindoff over the 20 sts that remain on the active needle 1 st remains † pro-tip the edges of the heel flap will later become the cuff opening so it s important they are elastic although many knitters prefer to slip the first stitch in a row when working back and forth i recommend working it my edge is much more elastic if i work the first stitch as is written 4 cuff setup pick up 8 loops on each side of the heel selvedge incorporating the gusset sts previously placed on hold you should now have 30 sts on the needles arrange sts so that the round ends with the live stitch at the back of the heel cuff round p1 k2 p2 3 times k1 tbl p1 k1 tbl p2 k2 3 times p1 k1 tbl work this round continuously until cuff is the desired height next 3 rounds knit then bind off all sts using jssbo toes now that the sock form is complete you will add applied i-cords for toes instructions below are written for working the cords manually but you could alternatively use a cordsmith please see section 5 of this video for a demonstration side toes start first you ll work one i-cord continuously from side to side cast on 3 sts onto a dpn insert the l tip of the dpn into the first stitch in the column of purl bumps along the side slide these 4 sts to the r side of the dpn and k2 ssk repeat this step until you have worked around the back of the heel to the last purl bump on the opposite side bind off center toe end next you ll work another i-cord continuously from bottom to top turn sock over on the bottom
